result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac J Gaudynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Pay fine in the amount of $1000.00 plus ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges within 6 months. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac J Gaudynski

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Isaac J Gaudynski in court.  Attorney Lew A Wasserman in court for Isaac J Gaudynski.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea/sentencing hearing. State filed an amended information, received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and projected to plead guilty.  Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY to the Amended Information.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

-Pay fine in the amount of $1000.00 plus ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges within 6 months. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
-Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Filed:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaac J Gaudynski in court with attorney MARTIN J WASSERMAN.  Defendant Isaac J Gaudynski in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
